references.paper_title: Pitfalls of epistemic uncertainty quantification through loss minimisation
references.reason: This paper is foundational for the current work by identifying crucial limitations in existing methods for epistemic uncertainty quantification.

references.paper_title: On second-order scoring rules for epistemic uncertainty quantification
references.reason: This paper provides further theoretical arguments about the limitations of using second-order scoring rules for epistemic uncertainty.

references.paper_title: Is epistemic uncertainty faithfully represented by evidential deep learning methods?
references.reason: This paper questions the reliability of distributional and aleatoric uncertainty learned by existing evidential deep learning methods.

references.paper_title: Predictive uncertainty estimation via prior networks
references.reason: This paper introduced the concept of prior networks, a foundational approach in evidential deep learning which is analyzed in detail in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Reverse KL-divergence training of prior networks: Improved uncertainty and adversarial robustness
references.reason: This paper is important as it proposes an improved version of prior networks which addresses some limitations of the original approach.
